title: Understanding SQL WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause in SQL is used to filter records. It is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.

title: Using Comparison Operators
text: Comparison operators in SQL are used to compare two values. The most common operators are: $$=$$, $$ \neq $$, <>, >, <, $$ \geq $$, $$ \leq $$.

title: Excluding a Specific Value
text: To exclude a specific value in SQL, you can use the $$' \neq '$$ or '<>' operators. For example, to exclude 'NY', you would use 'State $$ \neq $$ 'NY''.

hintAnswer: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE State $$ \neq $$ 'NY';
title: Constructing the SQL Query
text: Use the SELECT statement to choose the columns you want to display, and the WHERE clause to filter out 'NY'.
choices: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE State $$ \geq $$ 'NY';
SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE State IS 'CA' AND NOT 'NY';
SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE State $$ \neq $$ 'NY';
SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Student WHERE State $$=$$ 'CA', 'GA', 'NH';
